name: white_paper
description: Generic white paper generation for research, analysis, or business proposals - works across any domain

inputs.label: Paper Title
inputs.description: A clear, compelling title that captures the main topic or argument

inputs.label: Main Topic or Question
inputs.description: What is this paper about? What central question or problem are you addressing?

inputs.label: Target Audience
inputs.description: Who will read this? (e.g., 'Hospital executives', 'Research committee', 'Board of directors', 'Technical team')

inputs.label: Core Argument or Finding
inputs.description: What is the main point or conclusion you want readers to understand?

inputs.label: Types of Supporting Evidence
inputs.description: What data, research, examples, or evidence do you have? (e.g., 'Growth metrics from 22 months', 'Literature review findings', 'Survey results')

inputs.label: Desired Reader Action
inputs.description: What do you want readers to DO after reading this? (e.g., 'Approve staffing increase', 'Fund research', 'Change policy')

inputs.label: Any Constraints or Considerations
inputs.description: Anything we should avoid or be careful about? (e.g., 'Keep it under 3 pages', 'Avoid technical jargon', 'Highlight cost-benefit')

sections.title: Executive Summary
sections.description: 1-2 paragraphs: Core argument, key evidence, and desired action

sections.title: Background & Context
sections.description: Set the stage: Why this topic matters, what led to this analysis, what problem we're solving

sections.title: Key Findings & Analysis
sections.description: Evidence-based findings with supporting data, research, or examples in tables/bullets

sections.title: Implications & Recommendations
sections.description: What the findings mean and what readers should do about it

verification_questions.question: Does the paper clearly state the core argument and support it with evidence?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Ensure every claim in the findings section is supported by data from the notes.

verification_questions.question: Is the paper appropriate for the stated audience (not too technical, not too basic)?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Adjust language and depth based on target audience expertise level.

verification_questions.question: Are the key findings presented clearly with tables, bullets, or visuals rather than dense paragraphs?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Replace paragraph blocks with markdown tables and bullet points for scannability.

verification_questions.question: Does the paper clearly state what readers should do as a result?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Explicitly state the recommended action or decision in the implications section.

criteria.name: Conciseness
criteria.description: Paper is 2-3 pages max, no redundancy, every section earns its space

excellent.description: Tight 2-3 page format, no wasted words

criteria.name: Clarity & Argument Strength
criteria.description: Core argument is clear and supported by evidence

excellent.description: Crystal clear argument with strong evidence

adequate.description: Argument present but could be stronger

criteria.name: Audience Alignment
criteria.description: Content matches target audience's expertise and concerns

poor.description: Wrong level or focus for audience

criteria.name: Actionability
criteria.description: Clear, specific recommendations for reader action

excellent.description: Crystal clear next steps and recommendations
